abstract: Wall Street investment banks, in one of their worst dry spells for I.P.O.’s, are scrambling to get more business from China, despite the risks of buying shares of Chinese companies and growing concerns that a bubble may be forming in Chinese listings.
snippet: Wall Street investment banks, in one of their worst dry spells for I.P.O.’s, are scrambling to get more business from China, despite the risks of buying shares of Chinese companies and growing concerns that a bubble may be forming in Chinese listi...
lead_paragraph: Last April, when global financial markets were collapsing, a Chinese Web site named Sohu.com made a bold move to spin off its online gaming unit and list it on the Nasdaq Stock Market.

headline.main: Sparse U.S. Listings Prompt Rush on China I.P.O.’s

abstract: For the second time in less than five weeks, China’s central bank has moved to limit lending to consumers and businesses by ordering big commercial banks to park a larger share of their deposits at the central bank.
snippet: For the second time in less than five weeks, China’s central bank has moved to limit lending to consumers and businesses by ordering big commercial banks to park a larger share of their deposits at the central bank.
lead_paragraph: For the second time in less than five weeks, China’s central bank has moved to limit lending to consumers and businesses by ordering big commercial banks to park a larger share of their deposits at the central bank, Keith Bradsher reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Tighter Curbs on Lending in China

abstract: Sergey Brin, co-founder of Google, also urged other companies recently hit by Chinese hackers to speak out.
snippet: Sergey Brin, co-founder of Google, also urged other companies recently hit by Chinese hackers to speak out.
lead_paragraph: Sergey Brin, a Google co-founder, speaking publicly for the first time about the hacking attacks on Google in late 2009, said Friday that the company still hoped to find a way to continue operating its Google.cn search service in China, which it has blamed for the attacks.

headline.main: Google Co-Founder Hopeful About Uncensored Search in China
